text: [Music]
this is 1.2 kilometers of dirty
underwear
hang on washing line South Africa's
dirty laundry is rape awareness campaign
which is trying to bring awareness to
the issue of rape in South Africa
through anarchic installation which is
hanging in the streets of to him as Luke
the reason for using underwear for the
installation is because it's probably
the most personal item of clothing that
you wear it's also the last thing that
is taken in a rape scenario or when
somebody is violently or sexually
assaulted I mean it just from their
point of view is much more personal and
has much more symbolism having had a
sexual abuse situation when I was
younger my way of being as a person has
been very guarded I've always been very
removed from people and it's affected my
relationships in a negative way
the process of doing this project and
over the months that has been evolving
and I think I've become much more able
to tap into the human side of myself and
be more connected with people it's
allowed me to feel a sense of
connectedness I think a sense of
humanity which I struggled with before
I was six years old when I was first
molested and and I've been sexually
assaulted more than once so this piece
that I'm doing is called on the line and
it's about being someone who has loved
with the trauma of sexual violence all
of their life
I feel triggered as I perform the piece
itself my body shakes my heart
palpitates and I struggle to breathe and
my whole being wants to fly outside of
the situation and go somewhere where I
feel safe but I stay because I need to
fight for myself and I need to fight to
be alive and to feel free
[Music]
what I'm hoping to achieve is connection
the hope is that people will be able to
start to connect to each other stories
because there's a survivor you often
feel very alone and you feel that you're
the only one that's suffering the things
that you are suffering through so the
hope is that people will be able to
start talking about how they actually
feel by engaging with my performance and
how I have bought
[Music]
